ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Affiliative Tenor - Child behaviors in the interaction that indicates willingness to accept bids of affiliation and maintain an interaction with the social partner (for example, attention, social communication, imitations). Include both child initiations and response to parents bids.
Affiliative Initiation - Child active attempts in the interaction that indicates their will to initiate or maintain an interaction with the social partner
Affiliative Enjoyment - Child's enjoyment of the interaction, as evidenced by positive affect during and following social exchanges
Negative Affiliative Bids - Child use of improper, unregulated, or aggressive behavior in their attempt to interact with their social partner
